subject: Entrepreneurship
subcategory: Business Models That Changed the World
title: Why Platforms Beat Pipelines
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Why Platforms Beat Pipelines.

hook.text: Encyclopedia Britannica had 4,000 paid experts. Wikipedia had millions of free volunteersâ€”and won.

buildup.text: Pipeline businesses create value step by step: design, make, sell. Platforms let users do the creating.

discovery.text: Platforms scale at near-zero marginal cost. Adding one more user costs almost nothing.

twist.text: The best platforms don't compete with pipelines. They make pipelines compete with each other.

climax.text: When a platform reaches critical mass, switching costs lock users in and lock competitors out.

punchline.text: Don't build the factory. Build the marketplace.

quiz.question: Why do platforms scale more efficiently than pipeline businesses?
options: They always have better products than traditional companies
They pay workers less than pipeline businesses do
Adding each new user costs almost nothing because users create the value
